result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Miner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED. Credit for 7 days time served. Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No intoxicants. Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No going to taverns or bars. Do not enter establishment where primary purpose is sale of alcohol. No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years without agents approval and or chaperone.

Complete counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup especially Psychological, Sex Offender Treatment and Cognitive Intervention.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Comply with Sex Offender Registry Program under 301.45, Wis. Stats.  Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive with no good time and zero days credit. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
